question: When a partner disappoints you, how do you typically respond?

options.A: Shut down and withdraw emotionally for days
options.B: Explode in anger and bring up past issues
options.C: Calmly express how I feel and seek a constructive conversation
options.D: Pretend everything is fine to avoid conflict

question: How comfortable are you being alone for extended periods?

options.A: I feel anxious and incomplete without someone
options.B: I tolerate it but constantly look for distractions
options.C: I feel content, fulfilled, and happy in my own company
options.D: I avoid being alone at all costs

question: When someone gets close to you emotionally, what usually happens?

options.A: I feel excited and open up fully
options.B: I start feeling trapped and pull away
options.C: I enjoy it but only up to a certain point
options.D: I become overly clingy and fearful of losing them

question: Do you believe you can trust most people until they prove otherwise?

options.A: No — I assume everyone will eventually hurt me
options.B: Yes — I give trust freely and maintain it unless broken
options.C: Only after many tests and proofs
options.D: I trust no one completely

question: How do you handle your own stress or strong emotions?

options.A: I rely heavily on others to calm me down
options.B: I self-soothe and regulate myself effectively
options.C: I suppress them until they explode later
options.D: I distract myself with work, alcohol, etc.

question: Have you fully processed and moved on from your last serious relationship?

options.A: Yes — I feel neutral and ready for something new
options.B: Mostly, but I still compare new people to my ex
options.C: Not really — I still feel hurt/angry/residual love
options.D: I avoid thinking about it

question: When a conflict arises, how do you usually approach it?

options.A: I avoid it and hope it goes away
options.B: I criticize or blame the other person
options.C: I listen, express my view calmly, and seek compromise
options.D: I give the silent treatment

question: How important is personal growth to you right now?

options.A: Not really — I’m fine as I am
options.B: Very — I actively work on my flaws and self-awareness
options.C: Only when someone points them out
options.D: I think I’m perfect already

question: Do you feel emotionally safe enough to share your deepest fears?

options.A: Yes — with the right person, I can be fully vulnerable
options.B: Rarely — I keep most things private
options.C: Only after years of knowing someone
options.D: Never — vulnerability is weakness

question: What role does compromise play in your view of relationships?

options.A: I expect the other person to adjust to me
options.B: I’m willing to meet halfway without resentment
options.C: I avoid compromise — it feels like losing
options.D: I always give in to keep the peace

question: How do you feel about long-term commitment in general?

options.A: Excited — it aligns with my values and goals
options.B: Anxious — it feels like losing freedom
options.C: Neutral — depends on the person
options.D: Terrified — I don’t see myself committing

question: When your partner needs space, how do you react?

options.A: I panic and feel abandoned
options.B: I respect it and use the time productively
options.C: I get angry and accuse them of not caring
options.D: I give space but resent it silently

question: Are you content with your current life without a partner?

options.A: Yes — a relationship would add to it, not complete it
options.B: No — I feel something major is missing
options.C: Sometimes — it depends on the day
options.D: I’ve never really been single long enough to know

question: How do you view past relationship failures?

options.A: As learning experiences that helped me grow
options.B: As proof that relationships don’t work
options.C: I blame the other person completely
options.D: I avoid reflecting on them

question: Do you communicate your needs clearly without expecting mind-reading?

options.A: Yes — I express them directly and respectfully
options.B: No — I hint and hope they figure it out
options.C: Rarely — I fear seeming needy
options.D: I don’t even know what my needs are

question: How often do you fear abandonment or rejection?

options.A: Rarely — I feel secure in myself
options.B: Frequently — it affects my behavior a lot
options.C: Only in new relationships
options.D: Constantly — it’s always in the background

question: Can you maintain your identity and independence in a close relationship?

options.A: Yes — I stay true to myself while being connected
options.B: No — I tend to lose myself in partners
options.C: Sometimes — it depends on the person
options.D: I prefer to merge completely

question: How do you respond to constructive criticism from a partner?

options.A: I listen openly and consider it seriously
options.B: I get defensive and counter-attack
options.C: I ignore it or change the subject
options.D: I shut down emotionally

question: Do you have a clear vision of what you want in a long-term partner?

options.A: Yes — based on values, not just surface traits
options.B: No — I’ll know when I feel it
options.C: Only physical/emotional attraction matters
options.D: I change my mind constantly

question: Are you ready to invest consistent effort into building and maintaining a relationship?

options.A: Yes — I see it as a worthwhile lifelong project
options.B: Only if it’s easy and drama-free
options.C: I prefer low-effort connections
options.D: I’m not sure — relationships feel exhausting
